definitions: mammal that carries its young in a pouch after birth
examples: The marsupial hopped across the Australian outback at dawn
Kangaroos are the most famous marsupials in the world

definitions: retail establishment or marketplace where goods are sold to consumers
examples: The convenience mart stays open twenty-four hours every day
She bought fresh vegetables at the local farmers' mart

definitions: small carnivorous mammal with valuable fur related to weasels
examples: The pine marten climbed swiftly through the forest canopy
Trappers once hunted martens for their luxurious winter pelts

definitions: small bird with forked tail that feeds on flying insects
masculine personal name of Latin origin meaning warlike
examples: Purple martins nested in the specially designed birdhouse
The house martin built its mud nest under the eaves
Martin Luther King Jr. led the civil rights movement
Her brother Martin works as an aerospace engineer

definitions: person who demands strict adherence to rules and forms especially in military contexts
examples: The drill sergeant was a notorious martinet about uniform regulations
Her manager's reputation as a martinet made employees anxious

definitions: cocktail made with gin and vermouth garnished with olive or lemon
examples: He ordered a dry martini with two olives at the bar
James Bond famously prefers his martini shaken not stirred

definitions: person who suffers or dies for their beliefs or principles
person who exaggerates their suffering to gain sympathy or attention
examples: The early Christian martyrs died rather than renounce their faith
Joan of Arc became a martyr for French independence
Stop playing the martyr every time you have extra work
She acted like a martyr whenever she helped with chores

definitions: death or suffering endured for religious or principled beliefs
state of exaggerated suffering used to gain sympathy or attention
examples: His martyrdom inspired thousands to join the resistance movement
The saints achieved martyrdom rather than renounce their faith
Her constant martyrdom about household chores annoyed her family
He wore his minor inconveniences like badges of martyrdom

definitions: something that causes wonder, admiration, or astonishment
American comic book publisher known for superhero characters
examples: The ancient pyramid remains an architectural marvel after millennia
Modern medicine has produced marvels we once thought impossible
Marvel Comics created Spider-Man and the X-Men characters
The latest Marvel movie broke box office records worldwide

definitions: sweet paste made from ground almonds and sugar used in confectionery
examples: The wedding cake featured delicate marzipan roses on top
German stollen bread contains a layer of sweet marzipan

definitions: cosmetic substance applied to eyelashes to darken and thicken them
examples: She applied waterproof mascara before going to the pool
The makeup artist used volumizing mascara for dramatic effect

definitions: person, animal, or object adopted as symbolic figure by group or team
examples: The university's bear mascot entertained crowds at football games
Tony the Tiger serves as the breakfast cereal's mascot

definitions: grammatical category in languages that classifies nouns as male gender
examples: In Spanish, the word 'libro' takes the masculine article
French masculine nouns typically end with consonants

definitions: qualities or attributes traditionally associated with men or maleness
examples: Society's definition of masculinity has evolved over the decades
Toxic masculinity refers to harmful stereotypes about male behavior

definitions: soft pulpy mass made by crushing or beating something
mixture of crushed malt and hot water used in brewing
examples: She made potato mash with butter and cream for dinner
The baby food was a smooth mash of carrots
The brewmaster prepared the mash for the next batch of beer
Whiskey production begins with fermenting the grain mash

definitions: place of worship for followers of Islam where Muslims gather for prayer
examples: The community gathered at the masjid for Friday prayers
The new masjid features beautiful Islamic architectural elements

definitions: covering worn over face for protection, disguise, or entertainment
appearance or manner that disguises someone's true character or feelings
examples: Healthcare workers wore surgical masks throughout their shifts
The carnival dancers wore elaborate feathered masks
His cheerful demeanor was merely a mask for deep sadness
She dropped her professional mask when among close friends

definitions: act or process of covering or concealing something
phenomenon where one signal blocks perception of another signal
examples: Masking tape protected the window frames during painting
The masking of symptoms made diagnosis extremely difficult
Audio masking occurs when loud sounds obscure quieter ones
Frequency masking affects how we perceive multiple tones

definitions: tendency to derive pleasure especially sexual gratification from one's own pain or humiliation
examples: The psychology textbook discussed masochism as a complex phenomenon
Emotional masochism involves seeking out harmful relationship patterns

definitions: skilled worker who builds with stone, brick, or concrete blocks
member of the Freemasons fraternal organization
examples: The mason carefully laid each brick in the garden wall
Skilled masons restored the cathedral's crumbling stone facade
His grandfather was a prominent mason in the local lodge
The Masonic temple hosted the annual mason gathering

definitions: craft of building structures from individual units of stone, brick, or concrete
principles, rituals, and practices of the Freemasons fraternal organization
examples: The ancient masonry walls have stood for eight centuries
Reinforced masonry provides excellent structural support
He studied the history of masonry and its symbolic traditions
Masonry emphasizes moral development and charitable works

definitions: social gathering where participants wear masks and costumes
false show or pretense intended to deceive others
examples: The charity masquerade ball raised thousands for local schools
Venice hosts elaborate masquerade celebrations during Carnival
His kindness was a masquerade hiding ruthless ambition
The company's ethical stance was merely a masquerade

definitions: deliberate and brutal slaughter of many people
informal heavy defeat in sports or competition
examples: The historical massacre remains a dark chapter in human history
Witnesses testified about the brutal massacre of civilians
The home team suffered a massacre, losing by forty points
Critics called the movie review a complete massacre

definitions: rubbing and kneading of muscles and joints to relieve tension
manipulation of facts or figures to achieve desired result
examples: The sports therapist gave her a deep tissue massage
Swedish massage helps improve circulation and reduce stress
The accountant had to massage the numbers for the report
Politicians often massage statistics to support their arguments

definitions: compact group of mountains forming an independent geological unit
examples: The Mont Blanc massif dominates the Alpine landscape
Geologists studied the ancient volcanic massif for years

definitions: tall upright post on ship or boat supporting sails and rigging
tall structure supporting antennas for broadcasting or telecommunications
nuts of forest trees used as food for animals
examples: The sailing ship's main mast towered forty feet above deck
Storm winds snapped the forward mast like a matchstick
The radio mast broadcasts signals across the entire valley
Cell phone masts dot the urban landscape
Wild boars foraged for mast beneath the oak trees
The forest produced abundant mast that autumn season

definitions: surgical removal of all or part of breast tissue usually to treat cancer
examples: She underwent a preventive mastectomy due to genetic risk factors
The surgeon performed a partial mastectomy to remove the tumor

definitions: person with exceptional skill or knowledge in particular area
original recording, document, or artwork from which copies are made
advanced academic degree between bachelor's and doctorate
person having control or authority over others
examples: The chess master defeated twelve opponents simultaneously
She became a master of French pastry techniques
The studio preserved the original master recording in climate-controlled storage
They discovered the master painting hidden beneath a forgery
He earned his master's degree in environmental science
The master's program requires two years of study
The ship's master commanded a crew of thirty sailors
In medieval times, masters controlled apprentices' training

definitions: final step in audio production optimizing sound for distribution
process of acquiring complete knowledge or skill in something
examples: The album went through professional mastering before release
Audio mastering ensures consistent sound across all playback systems
Mastering calculus requires dedication and consistent practice
She focused on mastering the violin throughout her childhood

definitions: person with outstanding intellectual ability especially in planning
person who plans and directs complex scheme or enterprise
examples: The professor was a recognized mastermind in theoretical physics
She proved herself a marketing mastermind with innovative campaigns
Police finally caught the mastermind behind the elaborate heist
The terrorist mastermind coordinated attacks from multiple locations

definitions: work of outstanding artistry, skill, or workmanship in any field
examples: The Sistine Chapel ceiling remains Michelangelo's undisputed masterpiece
Critics hailed the novel as a literary masterpiece

definitions: position, authority, or skill of a master in any field
examples: He achieved mastership in the guild after years of training
The violinist's mastership was evident in every performance

definitions: comprehensive knowledge or skill in subject or accomplishment
control or superiority over something or someone
examples: Her mastery of multiple programming languages impressed employers
The pianist demonstrated complete mastery of the difficult piece
The empire established mastery over the entire region
He finally gained mastery over his destructive habits

definitions: printed matter in newspaper or magazine giving title and details
highest point of ship's mast
examples: The newspaper's masthead lists all senior editors and contributors
She proudly saw her name added to the magazine's masthead
The sailor climbed to the masthead to spot distant ships
The flag flew proudly from the ship's masthead

definitions: aromatic resin from Mediterranean trees used in varnishes
waterproof filler and sealant used in building
examples: Ancient Greeks chewed mastic as a breath freshener
The furniture restorer used mastic in the antique varnish
The contractor applied mastic to seal the bathroom tiles
Roofing mastic prevents water from penetrating joints

definitions: large powerful dog breed with drooping ears and pendulous lips
examples: The English mastiff weighs up to two hundred pounds
Their Tibetan mastiff guards the mountain property faithfully

definitions: extinct elephant-like mammal with long curved tusks from prehistoric times
examples: Scientists discovered mastodon fossils in the ancient tar pit
Mastodons roamed North America during the Ice Age

definitions: stimulation of one's own genitals for sexual arousal or pleasure
examples: Health education classes discuss masturbation as normal human behavior
Medical studies show masturbation has no harmful physical effects

definitions: piece of material placed on floor or surface for protection
tangled or densely interwoven mass of material
cardboard border placed around picture in frame
examples: She wiped her muddy boots on the welcome mat
Yoga students unrolled their mats for morning practice
The dog's fur had formed a thick mat behind its ears
Algae created a dense mat on the pond's surface
The photograph looked elegant with a cream-colored mat
Choose a mat that complements the artwork's colors

definitions: principal bullfighter who kills the bull in Spanish bullfighting
examples: The matador entered the arena wearing a traditional suit of lights
Famous matadors become celebrities throughout Spain and Latin America

definitions: small stick with combustible tip for starting fires
organized contest or game between opposing sides
person or thing that combines well with another
person or thing equal in quality or strength
examples: She struck a match to light the birthday candles
Keep matches away from children for fire safety
The tennis match lasted three hours in scorching heat
Tonight's football match determines the league champion
They make a perfect match with complementary personalities
This wine is an excellent match for grilled salmon
He finally met his match in the chess tournament
No one could match her expertise in molecular biology

definitions: small box or folder containing matches for lighting fires
examples: He collected vintage matchboxes from restaurants around the world
The matchbox rattled with only three matches left inside

definitions: person who arranges relationships and marriages between others
examples: The traditional matchmaker introduced compatible families for arranged marriages
Her friends acted as informal matchmakers at social events

definitions: practice or process of bringing people together for romantic relationships
examples: Online matchmaking services use algorithms to find compatible partners
Her mother's constant matchmaking attempts became increasingly annoying

definitions: pairing of opponents or teams in competition or comparison
examples: Tonight's matchup features the league's top two teams
The playoff matchups will be determined by regular season records

definitions: spouse or romantic partner in committed relationship
friend or companion especially in British and Australian usage
ship's officer below captain in rank
animal's partner for reproduction
examples: She introduced her mate at the company holiday party
They had been mates for over twenty years
He went to the pub with his mates after work
G'day mate, how are you doing today?
The first mate took command when the captain fell ill
The mate supervised loading cargo into the ship's hold
The zoo introduced a new mate for the endangered panda
Birds often choose the same mate each breeding season

definitions: informal British term for mother
protective membrane surrounding brain and spinal cord
examples: His dear old mater still sends care packages to university
The headmaster greeted each student's pater and mater
The dura mater is the outermost layer protecting the brain
Inflammation of the pia mater requires immediate medical attention

definitions: physical substance from which something is made or composed
information or ideas used in creating a work or performance
having relevance or importance to matter at hand
examples: The dress was made from sustainable organic material
Construction materials arrived at the building site yesterday
The comedian gathered material for her new standup routine
Classified material was leaked to international journalists
The witness provided material evidence to the investigation
These facts are not material to our current discussion

definitions: tendency to consider material possessions and comfort as more important than spiritual values
philosophical theory that physical matter is the fundamental reality
examples: Modern materialism drives people to accumulate unnecessary possessions
The preacher warned against the dangers of excessive materialism
Scientific materialism rejects supernatural explanations for natural phenomena
Dialectical materialism forms the foundation of Marxist philosophy

definitions: person who values material possessions and comfort above spiritual matters
person who believes physical matter constitutes fundamental reality
examples: The materialist couldn't understand her friend's minimalist lifestyle
He transformed from a materialist to someone valuing experiences
The materialist philosopher argued against religious explanations
Prominent materialists include Marx, Darwin, and Epicurus
